content.description: For those looking for a more endurance variation to AOB, this is it. Starts on the first two bolts of Ankle Biter, before traversing through the crux of Vicious Little Dog (second bolt) and into the 3rd and 4th bolts of Puppy Teeth. Finish up the last two bolts of AOB. This link-up doesn't really add anything in terms of grade IMO, with the main difficulties being the traverse through Vicious Little Dog and the crux of AOB. The clips are all good and none of the draws need to be extended although an extra attentive belay is probably best.
content.location: Starts on the far right side of the shortest section of the Shredder Wall and traverses to the farthest left anchor.

content.description: Tricky opening, bouldery crux beneath the small overlap. Sustained from there to the top. Bigger, more aggro moves than the other Chumley wall routes.
content.protection: 5 bolts, chain anchors (shared with Ankle Biter).
content.location: Fifth route from the left. Next route right of Puppy Teeth. Starts right at the small, pruned aspen tree.

content.description: Steppin' Out is located in the same indent as shredder, and shares very similar great movement on just as good rock. Steep and Sustained, no gimme at the grade. Head up some easy opening moves to a gear placement at around 20 ft, then head into the sustained moves until the chains.
content.protection: quickdraws, chain anchors, may want a small piece to tame a little runout(.3-.5-ish).
content.location: This route is just to the right of shredder, in the same indent in the wall. 3rd route from the left.

content.description: Shredder is located on the left side of the shredder wall, 2nd route from the left. The namesake and classic for the wall, it has great moves and solid rock, as well as very sustained and stiff. Head up through a few easy moves to a good stance at about 20 ft, then start up the sustained and techy face.
content.location: Shredder is located on the far left of the wall, 2nd line from the left. look for an indent in the wall with 3 routes inside of it.

content.description: Puppy teeth is short and steep on thin features. Be ready to learn about the name puppy teeth from the sharp crimps.
content.location: This is the fourth route from the left on the Shredder Wall, located on the shorter wall before the alcove. It is just right of AOB.

content.description: This route is just left of Shredder in the same indent in the wall. Route trends left through some steeper terrain and harder movement.
content.location: The furthest climb left on the Shredder Wall, to the left of Shredder.

content.description: Start slightly right of Chumley on the small platform.  Stick clip the high first bolt.  Move up and right into undercling and then through small sharp holds to gain a good pocket and slash. Finish on the last moves of AOB.
content.protection: 3 bolts to sport anchor shared with Chumley and AOB.
content.location: Second route from left on Dog Wall.

content.description: Chumley is another of the short and powerful climbs, packing a lot of climbing into 30 ft. Steep and sustained, some big moves on thin features.
content.location: This route is just right of steppin' out, just outside of the indent and to the left of Cujo.

content.description: Next route right of Cujo. Start in the shallow weakness. Stick clip first bolt. Traverse left at 3rd bolt. Hard and technical from first move to the last. This is the testpiece!
content.protection: 4 bolts to sport anchors (shared with Chumley).

content.description: Rightmost route on the Chumley wall. Bouldery start to surprisingly sustained small corner and finish. Chain top anchors.
content.protection: 1 bolt, couple small cams (Camalot #1 or so), couple of wires. Optional stick clip first bolt.
content.location: Located right of the small aspen tree.
